Managed Settings has been revamped to make developer use a lot more easy,

For those of you who are unfamiliar, a Managed Settings Store is a data store

In iOS 15, you could only have one Managed Settings Store per process.
Also, your app and device activity extensions
had to have different Managed Settings Stores.
This made it difficult to change settings in response to device activity.
Now, in iOS 16, you can create up to 50 Managed Settings Stores
per process, each with their own unique name.
These named stores are also automatically shared between
your app and all your app extensions.
Also, you can now remove all the settings in any given named store all at once.
